communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. All communications, including any attachments, between Commissioner Temple, Ross Laris and/or anyone else in the Commissioner's office and any of the following individuals:

Governor Landry
Landry's Chief of Staff: Kyle Rocketry
Landry's Communications Director: Kate Kelly
Landry's Deputy Chief of Staff: Andree Miller
Landry's Legislative Director: Lance Maxwell
Landry's Policy Director: John Kay
Landry's Policy Director: Millard Mule

Please limit the search to communications that include any of the following key words:

“ESG”
“environmental, social and governance"
“insurance”
“climate”
“claims”
“deregulate”
“deregulation"
“business-friendly”

2. All communications, including any attachments, between Commissioner Temple, Ross Laris and/or anyone else in the Commissioner's office and anyone communicating from any of the following email domains:

“@heritage.org”
“@heritageaction.com”
“@sfof.com."
“@api.org”
“@alec.org”
“@texaspolicy.com”
“@lifepowered.org”
“@1792exchange.com”
“@heartland.org”
“@patomak.com”
“@2ndvoteadvisors.com”
“@crcadvisors.com”
“@crcpublicrelations.com”
“@crcstrategies.com”
“@boydengrayassociates.com” 
“@heritageforamerica.org”
“@madisonstrategiesllc.com” 
“@americafirstpolicy.com”
“@americafirstworks.com”
“@ATR.org”
“@thefga.org”
“@fusionlawfirm.com”
“@thefga.org”
“@solutionsproject.org”
“@allianceforconsumers.org” 
“@alliancedefendingfreedom.org”  
“@publicfiduciary.net”  
“@consumersresearch.org” 
“@advancingamericanfreedom.com”

Please search your records from April 25, 2024 to the current date.

I am making this request on behalf of Fieldnotes, a media requester. Fieldnotes seeks the above listed records for noncommercial use as a representative of the news media. Fieldnotes qualifies as a news media organization under the definition provided by Congress in the OPEN Government Act because it “gathers information of potential interest to a large segment of the public, and uses its editorial skills to turn the raw materials into a distinct work, and distributes that work to an audience.”

Specifically, Fieldnotes is seeking this FOIA request because the information in it is of interest to a large portion of the public, including the many concerned citizens that regularly acquire information through our extensive range of publications. These publications include websites, blogs, newsletters, reports, press statements, social media networks such as Facebook, and Twitter. In addition, Fieldnotes reaches out to many traditional news media outlets that regularly broadcast our publications through television, radio, print and electronic articles and interviews.

Fieldnotes plans to compile the information from this request into a distinct, original work that will be released to the public through the publications listed above.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Colette Rosenberg
